intro: Gethyllis barkerae subsp. barkerae, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
